item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, March 13, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Amateur Telescope Making Main Page (58 points | 18 comments)
2. Mark Klein, AT&T whistleblower who revealed NSA mass spying, has died (1209 points | 251 comments)
3. Pirate Bay co-founder Carl Lundström has died (88 points | 10 comments)
4. My teen years: The transputer operating system (161 points | 24 comments)
5. Revealed: How the UK tech secretary uses ChatGPT for policy advice (23 points | 25 comments)
6. Dithering in Colour (57 points | 23 comments)
7. Practical UX for startups surviving without a designer (279 points | 94 comments)
8. Shadeform (YC S23) is hiring a senior founding engineer ( | hide)
9. The DuckDB Local UI (752 points | 163 comments)
10. Gemini Robotics (790 points | 463 comments)
11. Show HN: Time Portal – Get dropped into history, guess where you landed (352 points | 155 comments)
12. Internet shutdowns at record high in Africa as access 'weaponised' (85 points | 33 comments)
13. Ruth Belville: the "Greenwich Time Lady" who sold time from 1892 to 1940 (2022) (13 points | 2 comments)
14. xlskubectl – a spreadsheet to control your Kubernetes cluster (136 points | 44 comments)
15. Open source software for modeling soft materials (24 points | 3 comments)
16. Iconography of the PuTTY tools (305 points | 80 comments)
17. Time Trouble (9 points | discuss)
18. Peer-to-peer file transfers in the browser (512 points | 225 comments)
19. The Night Watch (2013) [pdf] (146 points | 25 comments)
20. Three Implementation Models for Scheme (1987) [pdf] (55 points | 4 comments)
21. Gemma 3 Technical Report [pdf] (443 points | 231 comments)
22. Shenmue (1999) reverse engineering reveals possible sun position oversight (151 points | 63 comments)
23. The cultural divide between mathematics and AI (233 points | 135 comments)
24. The Future Is Niri (367 points | 186 comments)
25. Reverse engineering OpenAI code execution to make it run C and JavaScript (244 points | 59 comments)
26. My stupid noise journey (2023) (136 points | 149 comments)
27. Open-UI: Maintain an open standard for UI and promote its adherence and adoption (319 points | 96 comments)
28. I stopped everything and started writing C again (329 points | 334 comments)
29. 'Uber for nurses' exposes 86K+ medical records, PII via open S3 bucket (257 points | 141 comments)
30. Zinc, a systems programming language prototype (118 points | 52 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, March 13, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
